column4: I can't control wireless probably.. When I shut it down I can't open it again until I restart my computer
I can't control wireless probably.. When I shut it down I can't open it again until I restart my computer
Can you please rephrase your question.
I have Intel chipset wireless module. When I start ubuntu it works fine..... but when I switch it off then try to switch on again it doesn't respond. it keeps off. I have to restart my computer
Does it show up in network manager after you turn it back on?
I don't have network manager.. I have this icon in the taskbar... but it removes the wireless connection choice from it
Pici:I don't have network manager.. I have this icon in the taskbar... but it removes the wireless connection choice from it
I don't have network manager.. I have this icon in the taskbar... but it removes the wireless connection choice from it
Are you turning off the wireless from the kill-switch or are you hibernating or suspending the laptop?
no.. I use the fn key
Intel pro... I don't know its number... I don't know where can I find the device manager in ubuntu
Intel pro... I don't know its number... I don't know where can I find the device manager in ubuntu
Unforunately, it looks like the bugtracker launchpad.net is down, so I'm unable to look for a bug currently.
you can try to do: sudo invoke-rc.d networking restart   instead of rebooting your computer next time.  Or look on Launchpad in a few minutes.
